posts.text:
I had T1Hg removed and then a catheter for several days. Even then had some bleeding for several days after that.
If you're really concerned call your urologist. Mine has been very supportive with any questions anytime I call.

Thanks all, somehow it does help to know others are going though the same thing. But wish you weren't.

I do think I will ask urologist for help with anxiety. Yes, I can man up and just do it, but if it could be a bit easier, why not?

Also might give meditation a try.
Kagels seem to help calm the spasms a little for me.
I'm glad to hear that you're feeling good. I just had my second BCG and I feel fine if just a slight irritation in the area. No complaints!
